numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows percentages of women and men.
2. Women stay in touch with their families at least once a week.
3. Men stay in touch with their families at least once a week.
4. The percentage of women is greater than the percentage of men across all mediums.
5. Texting has the highest percentage for women.
6. Texting has the highest percentage for men.
7. Visiting in person has the lowest percentage for women.
8. Visiting in person has the lowest percentage for men.
9. For texting, the difference between women and men is the greatest.
10. For phone chat and video chat, the difference between women and men is the greatest.
11. For texting, the percentage of women is about 25% higher than the percentage of men.
12. For phone chat and video chat, the percentage of women is about 25% higher than the percentage of men.
13. For in-person visits, the difference between women and men is the smallest.
14. For in-person visits, the percentage of women is about 5% higher than the percentage of men.
15. I wonder why women communicate with their parents more often than men do.
16. This may suggest that women are closer to their parents than men are.
17. I wonder why some people visit their parents in person.
18. Some parents may live nearby.
19. Some people may commute in order to visit their parents in person.
20. I want to compare these statistics to statistics of teenagers.
21. I want to know if the statistics change when teenagers become young adults.
22. I am a college student.
23. It is important that my peers remain in touch with our parents.
24. It is important that I remain in touch with my parents.
25. The headline could be: How young adults are staying in touch with their parents.
